greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = Product_{d|n, gcd(d,n/d) is prime} gcd(d,n/d).
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..65537
example: For n = 12, with divisors 1, 2, 3, 4, 6, 12, we select from the sequence gcd(1,12/1), gcd(2,12/2), gcd(3,12/3), gcd(4,12/4), gcd(6,12/6), gcd(12,12/12) = 1, 2, 1, 1, 2, 1 only those that are primes, namely the two 2's, and form their product, thus a(12) = 2*2 = 4.
program: (PARI) A295666(n) = { my(m=1,p); fordiv(n, d, p = gcd(d, n/d); if(isprime(p), m *= p)); m; };
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, Nov 26 2017
